intro: Wahlenbergia sparticula, commonly known as the slender bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, oval leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Wahlenbergia sparticula is a perennial herb that is often found in open, sunny areas.
